priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Morphology Test Code Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C114117

self.title: CDISC SDTM Morphology Test Code Terminology

definition: A terminology codelist based on the test codes for macroscopic assessments that are seen by the naked eye or observed via procedures such as imaging modalities, endoscopy, or other technologies.
name: Morphology Test Code
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Morphology Test Code Terminology

terms.definition: A measurement of change in volume of an organ or anatomical feature as determined by a shift in tissue boundary over time.

An indication as to whether there is a new acute reduction in coronary flow (TIMI grade 0-1) in the absence of dissection, thrombus, spasm, or high-grade residual stenosis at the original PCI lesion site.
terms.preferredTerm: Coronary No Reflow at PCI Site Indicator

terms.definition: A measurement of the number of cells contained in a unit of volume.
The maximum number in a group of values that represent the cell density.
The minimum number in a group of values that represent the cell density.
The mean number in a group of values that represent the cell density.
The standard deviation in a group of values that represent the cell density.
The appearance of objects (or light sources) described in terms of a person's perception of their hue and lightness (or brightness) and saturation. (NCI)
The ratio of the diameter of the optic cup compared to the diameter of the optic disc. (NCI)
The extent downward or inward; the perpendicular measurement from the surface downward to determine deepness. (NCI)
The length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and connecting two points on the circumference. (NCI)
The minimum number in a group of values that represent the diameter of an object.
The mean number in a group of values that represent the diameter of an object.
The standard deviation in a group of values that represent the diameter of an object.
A quantitative measurement of an organ's ability to deform in response to physiological force and return to its normal shape by passive elastic recoil.
An indication as to whether there is re-narrowing of a stent implanted at a lesion site to treat a prior stenosis, to a diameter stenosis of greater than 50% within the stent.

An act or process of elucidation; explication, or explanation of the meaning of the event or thing via the assignment of objects from the domain to the constants of a formal language, truth-values to the proposition symbols, truth-functions to the connectives, other functions to the function symbols, and extensions to the predicates, if any. The assignments are result of human logic application and are not native to the symbols of the formal language.
The difference between the mean minimum lumen diameter (MLD) assessed immediately after an index procedure and the MLD assessed at follow-up angiography.
The longest possible length of a straight line passing through the center of a circular or spheroid object that connects two points on the circumference.
The linear extent in space from one end of something to the other end, or the extent of something from beginning to end. (NCI)
The condition or state of the lens of the eye. (NCI)
An indication as to whether there is re-narrowing of a lesion site following treatment of a prior stenosis, to a diameter stenosis of greater than 50% at the previously treated lesion site.
The amount of matter in an object.
The mean of the inside diameters of the normal blood vessel segments.
The minimum diameter of the inside of a blood vessel (lumen) derived quantitatively in a single view.
The value calculated as 100 x (1 - MLD/RVD), using the mean quantitative values for minimum lumen diameter (MLD) and reference vessel diameter (RVD).
The spatial arrangement of something as distinct from its substance. (NCI)
The dimension between two surfaces of an object, usually the smallest dimension as opposed to the width or the length.
The maximum number in a group of values that represent the thickness of an object.
The minimum number in a group of values that represent the thickness of an object.
The mean number in a group of values that represent the thickness of an object.
The standard deviation in a group of values that represent the thickness of an object.
The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container. (NCI)
The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity. (NCI)
The extent or measurement of something from side to side. (NCI)
